LCM = 4
= ((1x3)-(2x1))/4
= (3-2)/4

Volume of remaining cooking oil = 924 cm³
Base Area x height = volume
πr2h = volume
22/7 x 7 x 7 x h = 194
154h = 924
154h/154 = 924/154
h = 6","options":["Height = 16 cm","Height = 8 cm","Height = 6 cm"],"mark":3,"id":"ple_math_sect_B24_8_sub_0","user_answer":null},{"question":"Joan poured the remaining cooking oil into a rectangular tin with base area 77 cm2. It then continued to town C and covered a distance of 96 kilometres at a speed of 64 km/hr.","sub_questions":[{"question":"Calculate the total distance covered by the bus from town A to town C.","type":"multipleChoice","answer":"216 kilometres","explanation":"Time from town A to B is 2 hours
Speed = 60km/hr
Distance from town A to B = Speed x Time
= 60 x 2
= 120km/hr
Total distance = Distance from town A to B + Distance from town B to C
= 120km + 96km
= 216km","options":["200 kilometres","216 kilometres","120 kilometres"],"mark":3,"id":"ple_math_sect_B27_1_sub_0","user_answer":null},{"question":"At what time did the bus reach town C?","type":"multipleChoice","answer":"1:40 p.m","explanation":"Time from B to C
= Distance/Speed
= 96/64 hours
Total Time = Time from A to B+Time at B+Time from B to C
= 2 hours + 40/60 hours + 96/64 hours
= 2 hours + 2/3 hours + 3/2 hours
= 13/6 hours
Arrival time at town C = 11:30a.m + 13/6 hours
Convert 13/6 hours to minutes
= 13/6 x 60 minutes
= 130 minutes
= 1:40p.m","options":["1:30 p.m","1:40 p.m","11:30 a.m"],"mark":3,"id":"ple_math_sect_B27_1_sub_1","user_answer":null}],"id":"ple_math_sect_B27_1","user_answer":null}],"$id":"document_26"},{"category":28,"instructions":null,"questions":[{"question":"Mugisha is twice as old as Mugume. In 10 years time, the difference in their age will be 18 years. How old is Mugume?","type":"multipleChoice","answer":"18 years old","explanation":"Mugume's age now: k
Mugume's age in 10 years: k + 10
Mugisha's age now: 2k
Mugisha's age in 10 years: 2k+10
Mugisha - Mugume = 18
(2k+10) - (k+10) = 18
2k+10-k-10 = 18
k = 18","options":["20 years old","16 years old","18 years old"],"mark":2,"sub_questions":[{"question":"Find their total age","type":"multipleChoice","answer":"Total age = 54 years","explanation":"Mugisha = 2 x k
= 2x18
= 36 years
Total = 36+18
= 54 years","options":["Total age = 50 years","Total age = 44 years","Total age = 54 years"],"mark":2,"id":"ple_math_sect_B28_10_sub_0","user_answer":null}],"id":"ple_math_sect_B28_10","user_answer":null}],"$id":"document_27"},{"category":29,"instructions":null,"questions":[{"question":"At a kampala bus park, buses travelling to Arua and Mbarara leave after every 40 minutes and 50 minutes respectively. The first buses to the two towns leave together at 6:00 am. At what time will buses to the two towns leave Kampala together again?","type":"multipleChoice","answer":"9:20 a.m","explanation":"LCM of 40 and 50
= 2 x 2 x 2 x 5 x 5
= 200 minutes
They will leave together after 200 minutes or 3hrs 20mins
200 minutes = 200/60
= 3⅓ hours
= 3hrs and 20minutes
= 6:00 a.m + 3:20
= 9:20 a.m","options":["10:20 a.m","8:20 a.m","9:20 a.m"],"mark":4,"id":"ple_math_sect_B29_6","user_answer":null,"sub_questions":[]}],"$id":"document_28"},{"category":30,"instructions":null,"questions":[{"question":"The diagram below shows a square BCDE enclosed in a circle with centre O and radius 14cm. (Use π = 22/7)","type":"multipleChoice","answer":"Area = 616 cm2","explanation":"Area = π x (radius)cm2
= 22/7 x 14cm2
= 22/7 x 14 x 14
= 22 x 2 x 14
= 616 cm2","options":["Area = 88 cm2","Area = 44 cm2","Area = 616 cm2"],"mark":2,"id":"ple_math_sect_B30_3_sub_0","user_answer":null},{"question":"Find the area of the shaded part.","type":"multipleChoice","answer":"Area of shaded part = 224 cm2","explanation":"Area of the shaded part = Area of circle - Area of square area of square
Area of square;
d1 = 14 + 14
d1 = 28 cm
d2 = 28 cm
= 1/2 x d1 x d2
= 1/2 x 28 x 28
= 14 x 28
= 392 cm2
Shaded area = 616 cm2 - 392 cm2
= 224 cm2","options":["Area of shaded part = 124 cm2","Area of shaded part = 224 cm2","Area of shaded part = 120 cm2"],"mark":4,"id":"ple_math_sect_B30_3_sub_1","user_answer":null}],"id":"ple_math_sect_B30_3","user_answer":null}],"$id":"document_29"},{"category":31,"instructions":null,"questions":[{"question":"In a class, 1/5 of the girls are boarders while 1/3 of the boys are day scholars. The percentage of the girls in the class in 60%. The class has 10 boys who are day scholars.","sub_questions":[{"question":"How many pupils are in the class?","type":"multipleChoice","answer":"75 pupils","explanation":"Girls = 60% = 60/100
= 3/5
Boys = 5/5 - 3/5
= 2/5
Boys day scholars = 1/3 of 2/5
= 1/3 x 2/5
= 2/15
Let the total number of pupils be n
2/15 x n = 10
15 x 2/15n = 10 x 15
2n = 150
n = 75 pupils","options":["70 pupils","65 pupils","75 pupils"],"mark":3,"id":"ple_math_sect_B31_3_sub_0","user_answer":null},{"question":"Find the number of girls who are borders","type":"multipleChoice","answer":"9 girls","explanation":"Number of girls = 3/5 x 75
= 3 x 15
= 45 girls
Girls in boarding = 1/5 x 45
= 9 girls","options":["10 girls","9 girls","8 girls"],"mark":2,"id":"ple_math_sect_B31_3_sub_1","user_answer":null}],"id":"ple_math_sect_B31_3","user_answer":null}],"$id":"document_30"},{"category":32,"instructions":null,"questions":[{"question":"A tourist left town A and travelled 55 km westwards to town B.
